questions.question: What is the first step in the process when configuring Portfolio Planning to work with ServiceNow® Project Portfolio Management?

comments.content: The first step in configuring Portfolio Planning to work with ServiceNow® Project Portfolio Management (PPM) is to create an alignment integration.

A should by the first step:
Configuration workflow
Use the following steps as guidelines for your Portfolio Planning with Project Portfolio Management (PPM) setup process. Some of these steps require the admin role (sn_align_core.apw_admin) and some require the user role (sn_align_core.apw_user).

Create an alignment integration.
Generate default mapping configurations.
Create custom mapping configurations.
Guided Setup
After installing Portfolio Planning, you can use the guided setup to help you with the required configuration. To open the guided setup, navigate to Portfolio Planning > Guided Setup.

Answer is A. Create an alignment integration.
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/portfolio-planning/concept/configuring-portfolio-planning-with-ppm.html

questions.question: Which role should be assigned to a user so they can read and retrieve data from any table of the Release Management application to generate reports?

comments.content:
Use the business stakeholder role to read and retrieve data from any table of the Release Management application to generate reports.

When you activate the Business Stakeholder plugin (com.snc.business_stakeholder) in your ServiceNow instance, the Read only roles for Release Management plugin (com.snc.release_management_read_roles) is also activated. This plugin provides a business stakeholder role (sn_release_read) with which you can access all the tables of the Release Management application. You can assign this role to any user in your organization who is a business stakeholder.

Use the business stakeholder role to read and retrieve data from any table of the Release Management application to generate reports.   https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-service-management/page/product/release-management/reference/business-stakeholder-role-for-release-management.html

questions.question: If an it_project_manager does not want to equally distribute hours across the resource plan time frame, what allocation spread should be used?

comments.content:
https://www.servicenow.com/community/spm-articles/operational-resource-plan-all-that-you-need-to-know/ta-p/2299471

Allocation Spread: It has two values:
     i. Even
    ii. Front load
    Default Value: Even

    
     If the requirement is to evenly allocate the hours, then select Even otherwise select Front load.

If an it_project_manager does not want to equally distribute hours across the resource plan time frame, the allocation spread should be set to Any. This option allows the it_project_manager to manually enter the hours for each month or quarter in the resource plan.
Correct answer is C, not D

If an it_project_manager does not want to equally distribute hours across the resource plan time frame, the allocation spread should be set to Any. This option allows the it_project_manager to manually enter the hours for each month or quarter in the resource plan. The other options (Even, Back Load, and Front Load) automatically distribute the hours evenly, from the end, or from the start of the time frame, respectively.

questions.question: If the ‘Move project for WIP projects’ property is enabled, project tasks associated with the project are also moved, except for tasks in which of the following states? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
It is AB. Open and Pending states ARE moved WIP and closed state are NOT moved which is what the question is asking for.
If set to true, this property enables you to move the projects which are in WIP state.
Note: When a project is moved, only tasks in open and pending state are moved and the project takes the rolled up dates from all the project tasks.
Default value: false

A & B are correct

Enable move project for WIP projects (com.snc.project.move_project.wip), If set to true, this property enables you to move the projects which are in WIP state.

Note: When a project is moved, only tasks in open and pending state are moved and the project takes the rolled up dates from all the project tasks.
Default value: false

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/reference/r_InstalledWithProjectManagement.html

Tasks in the Pending state do not exist (pending state is for the project, not a task). Therefore  "C" is correct as it will never happen.
Closed tasks are not copied to new projects. So "C" is also correct.
This is a trick question.

If set to true, this property enables you to move the projects that are in WIP state. Note: When a project is moved, only tasks in open and pending state are moved and the project takes the rolled up dates from all the project tasks.
Default value: false
https://learning.servicenow.com/lxp/en/pages/learning-course?id=learning_course&course_id=109912a947145e14123f3975d36d435a&child_id=d79916e9871456d086dc8598cebb351b&spa=1

questions.question: Where is planned cost calculated from when requesting resources from a group and when resource role is specified?
answers: C. The hourly rate of the specified role.

comments.content:
Planned cost is rolled up from Requested Allocations for plans in the Planning or Requested state and from Resource allocations for plans in the Confirmed or Allocated state. While requesting resources from a group, if a resource role is specified, the planned cost is calculated from the hourly rate of the specified role. 

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/resource-management/reference/rsrc-plan-form-tabs.html

questions.question: Which is the minimum role that has access to the Project Administration > Settings > Preferences-Project module?

comments.content: While other roles like it_project_manager might have access to project-related functions, it_pps_admin is the most appropriate for accessing the Preferences-Project module, which is part of the overall project administration settings.

questions.question: What is a data copy of the current project's task, schedule, or structure that can be used for comparison reporting later?

comments.content:
Compare baselines to review variance between tasks and identify which task has variance from the current planned end date and the baseline end date. The baseline variance column displays the amount of variance between the two date comparisons.

Create schedule baselines at various stages of a project, for example, at the end of each phase or after every calendar month or quarter. Each baseline captures the schedule information of project tasks at a particular moment. This snapshot provides a basis for comparison and helps you to identify and review the changes made to the project. Having multiple baselines and comparing them helps you track the performance of your projects.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/task/compare-schedule-baselines-prj.html

questions.question: Which stage of the Now Create methodology includes Transition, Mobilize, Prepare and Conduct?

comments.content:
The Transition stage of the Now Create methodology includes the activities of Transition, Mobilize, Prepare and Conduct. This stage is
focused on transitioning the solution from development to production, mobilizing the stakeholders for the go-live, preparing the
environment and data for the launch, and conducting the final testing and validation. You can find more information about the Transition
stage in the Now Create ebook for the Project Methodology

The correct answer is C

A - Prepare  & B - Transition, do not exist stages in the now create methodology

The 5 phases are: 
1. Initiate: Transition, Mobilize, Prepare, Conduct 
2. Plan: Workshop, Processes, issues addressed, backlog, release planning, update 
3. Execute: Configure, Agile, Engagement, Reporting 
4. Deliver: UAT, Training, Go Live, Support, Transition 
5. Close: Feedback, Summaries, Assessments
Prepare is the correct answer.

questions.question: In which table can you find cost information for a specific fiscal period?

comments.content: Cost information for a specific fiscal period can be found primarily within the Cost Plan Breakdown table and the Financials module. Specifically, you can navigate to the Cost Plan Breakdown table, filter by the desired fiscal period, and then aggregate the cost data to get a total for that period. Additionally, the Overview tab in the Financials module (introduced in the Tokyo release) provides a breakdown of Budget, Planned Cost, Actual Cost, and Variance by fiscal year and quarters
A is correct.  The cost_plan_breakdown table has fiscal period field.  There is not expense_line table.  There isa fm_expense_line table but that table does not have any fiscal periods.

The expense_line table in ServiceNow stores cost information for specific fiscal periods. This table includes details about the actual costs incurred, broken down by fiscal periods, and is often used for financial tracking and reporting.

questions.question: When copying a source project to a target project, what fields are copied by default? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
By default only the short description, planned dates and duration fields are copied from source project to the target project. 

If additional columns must be copied, they should be declared in the project property List of attributes that will be copied from the originating project task.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/task/t_CopyAProject.html

questions.question: Is resource capacity derived from FTE or schedules?

comments.content: Capacity: Total capacity trend for the resources, which is derived from the user or group schedule. The group capacity is rolled up from the schedules of all the members. Note: Capacity is not derived from FTE, but from schedules. Both FTE and schedules must be in synchronization with each other.

questions.question: Which of the following defines a parent-child relationship? (Choose two.)
answers: A. A parent-child task must finish before another begins.
B. Parent-child task relationships do not have any effect on task time constraints.
C. Any number of child tasks can be nested under a parent task with or without any dependencies.
D. A parent-child relationship is not saved as a record in any table.

comments.content:
A parent-child relationship is different from a dependency relationship. In a dependency, one task must finish before another begins. -->In a parent-child relationship, any number of tasks can be nested under a parent task with or without any dependencies<--. When you create a parent-child relationship, the parent task number is saved in the Parent field in the Project Tasks table. All project management tasks have a parent: either another project task or the project itself.

Unlike a dependency, -->a parent-child relationship is not saved as a record in any table<--. The only modification that takes place when a parent-child relationship is modified is the Parent field in the child task record.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/concept/c_Parent-ChildTaskRelationships.html
I think D is correct due to no records created

B. Repeats every week on weekdays Monday through Friday from 8:00am to noon and 1:00-5:00pm.
C. Repeats every week on weekdays Monday through Friday from 9:00am to 5:00pm.
D. Repeats every week on weekdays Monday through Friday.

comments.content:
Correct B
https://www.servicenow.com/community/spm-forum/project-management-schedule-explanation-on-the-different-fields/m-p/2611137#:~:text=The%20default%20schedule%20for%20all%20new%20projects%2C%20which,total%20of%208%20hours%29%2C%20not%20including%20weekends.%20https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.servicenow.com%2Fbundle%2Futah-it-business-management%2Fpage%2Fproduct%2Fresource-management%2Fconc

Procedure:
1. Open a project.
2. If the Default view is active, right-click the header bar and select View > Advanced.
3. Select a schedule in the Schedule field.

Project Management Schedule	
The default schedule for all new projects which is Monday to Friday 8 A.M. to 12 P.M. and 1 P.M. to 5 P.M. (for a total of 8 hours), not including weekends.

questions.question: What are some basics of Demand Management? (Choose two.)
answers: B. Use the Project Workspace to compare and assess demands

comments.content:
Based on the below, the answer should be A & C

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/planning-and-policy/concept/c_DemandManagement.html

Basics of Demand Management
•	Set up the application: Plan, create stakeholders and assessment categories, and create bubble charts.
•	Assess ideas: Review and analyze submitted ideas before promoting ideas to demands.
•	Create and add details to the demands: Create demands and add demand tasks, stakeholders and assessments, and evaluate and qualify demands.
•	Use the Demand Management application or the demand workbench to compare and assess demands, and promote demands to projects, enhancements, changes, or defects.

questions.question: What is the formula for Forecasted Utilization?

comments.content:
The correct answer is C

Forecasted Utilization

Percentage of forecasted resource time utilization. It is calculated as sum of allocated and confirmed hours, divided by the total capacity.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-business-management/page/product/resource-management/concept/c_UsingResourceManagementReports.html#:~:text=Forecasted%20Utilization,the%20total%20capacity.

questions.question: Resource plan costs are divided into: (Choose three.)

comments.content:
ABC: Resource plan costs can be tracked directly in the resource plan record. Resource plan costs are divided into planned, allocated, and actual.
